CSEC-28 Implementation Summary

Status: âœ… COMPLETED

Tool: Shield AI Backend

---

What Was Implemented:

Shield AI Backend now detects and fixes missing or insecure Django security headers configurations in an environment-aware manner.

Pattern Detection:
- Detects 7 types of insecure configurations
- HSTS disabled or timeout too short
- SSL redirect disabled
- Content-Type nosniff disabled
- X-Frame-Options set to SAMEORIGIN
- Session/CSRF cookies not marked as secure

Security Headers Configured (Production Mode):
- SECURE_HSTS_SECONDS: 31536000 (1 year)
- SECURE_SSL_REDIRECT: True
- SECURE_CONTENT_TYPE_NOSNIFF: True
- X_FRAME_OPTIONS: DENY
- SESSION_COOKIE_SECURE: True
- CSRF_COOKIE_SECURE: True

Security Benefits:
- Prevents clickjacking attacks
- Prevents MIME sniffing attacks
- Prevents protocol downgrade attacks
- Prevents man-in-the-middle attacks
- Prevents session hijacking
- Prevents CSRF attacks

Compliance:
- OWASP Top 10 A5:2021
- OWASP ASVS V14.4
- Mozilla Web Security Guidelines
- NIST 800-53 SC-8

Usage:
python -m shield_ai scan /path/to/coco-testai --pattern csec_28_security_headers
python -m shield_ai fix /path/to/coco-testai --pattern csec_28_security_headers --framework django

Files Created:
- shield_ai/patterns/csec_28_security_headers.yaml
- shield_ai/fix_templates/csec_28_python.py
- Updated README.md and QUICKSTART.md
